info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:16PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN PREBLE AND WESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES THROUGH 300 PM EDT... At 216 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over West Alexandria, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, half inch hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Trotwood, Miamisburg, Vandalia, Englewood, Eaton, Moraine, West Carrollton, Lewisburg, West Alexandria, Gratis, Clayton, Brookville, Germantown, New Lebanon, Farmersville, Shiloh, Verona, West Manchester and Oklahoma. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 10 and 33. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
